answers.answer: Why do you have to have a c-section?
My first pregnancy was c-section and im also high risk

The term "high-risk pregnancy" describes a case where a pregnant woman has one or more factors that could put her or the fetus at risk for health problems.is 35 years old or olderis 17 years old or youngeris underweight or overweight prior to becoming pregnantis pregnant with more than one fetushas gestational diabeteshas gone into premature laborhas had a premature babyhas had a baby with a birth defect, especially heart or genetic problemshas high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes, lupus, asthma, a seizure disorder, or another longstanding medical problem
Congratulations :) <3 have a safe and Blessed c-section and enjoy your baby. God is right beside you :)

question: My due date is on june 3, I'm 31 wks and days and my doctor told me i was going to have a c-section when I'm 37 wks, I have 39 more days to go.....ufff
